commitResults.messageTitle: Completed Level-1. Greet, Echo, Exit
Completed Level-2. Add, List
Completed Level-3. Mark as Done. Added Task class.
Completed Level-4.
Completed Level-5. Handle errors. Added DukeExceptions package and classes. Abstracted functionality from Duke class to lower classes. Refactored certain components to work with exceptions.
Completed Level-6. Delete. Added new DukeExceptions class. Fixed regex bug in the ToDoList changeState method.
Updated testcase
Complete Level-7. Save. Added StateSaver class. Added functionality in the Task classes to work with StateSaver.
Add Level-8. Dates and Times.

Add packages, gradle, and more OOP. Refactored main method logic into Ui, Commands, Parser classes. Added Commands package. Added Tasks package. Renamed StateSaver to Storage. Renamed ToDoList to TaskList. Added all classes to packages.
Add unit tests for Parser and Duke classes. Added junit tests for the two classes. Fixed package names to follow naming convention.
Add JavaDocs for some classes. Added JavaDocs for Duke, Storage, Parser, Ui, TaskList and DateHandler Classes.
Add A-JavaDocs. Added JavaDocs for the rest of the classes, bar the exceptions.
Add Level-9. Find. Created FindCommand class. Added corresponding methods to TaskList class.
Fix storage bugs. Fixed bug where state was not saved after executing certain commands. Added JavaDocs for previously added methods.
Add Level-10. GUI Added basic GUI for the Duke chatbot.
Update Storage to use assertions. Storage methods use exceptions to handle assumptions - files existing.
commitResults.messageBody:
The use of exceptions makes it seem like the file not existing is a
condition that could potentially occur.

Extracting this code into assertions makes the code more intuitive as
this behaviour is assumed to be true.

Let's add assertions in the code in places where it is assumed that the
file exists, as it should have been created if it did not.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update all Commands to state assertions. Commands are assumed to be initialised with non-null inputs.
commitResults.messageBody:
There is no explicit catch for this, and it is possible that one may
mistakenly use null in their declaration of a command.

Let's add an assertion that the input is not null when initialising the
command.

It is more intuitively stated so that the class is not misused, and if
it is used wrongly, java can catch that mistake.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add A-Assertions. Cleaned up some commented code. Refactored Duke's getResponse to properly show the exceptions that occured. Added min height to DialogBox to deal with output/input longer than 4 lines.
Clean up Command code. Standardise JavaDocs. Remove unused commented code.
Improve comments of Task classes. Standardise JavaDocs.
Update build.gradle. Update the run configuration in the build.gradle file.
Refactor Ui showError method. showError prints directly to sys.out.
commitResults.messageBody:
GUI takes input directly, does not print to sys.out.

Let's refactor showError to return the message instead of printing.

Using this method is preferable as the showError method can then be used
in more areas where the GUI is used.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add A-CodeQuality. Clean up dead code. Standardise JavaDocs.
Update Parser to be more user-friendly. Parser is not lenient when it comes to capitalisation and whitespace.
commitResults.messageBody:
This makes the commands very rigid and not friendly to users; users may
be frustrated if their command is refused due to whitespace or caps.

Let's update Parser to ignore trailing whitespace and capitalisation.

Making the Parser more lenient helps to improve the UX.

commitResults.messageTitle: Revert "Update Parser to be more user-friendly."
Revert "Revert "Update Parser to be more user-friendly.""
Add C-Help. Add help command to help users with commands. Improve UX. Remove dead code.
Improve GUI. Add A-BetterGui. Add A-Personality.
Refactor classes into packages. Add all classes to a package except for launcher and Duke.
